page.title: 08Kettlethorpe/Fenton Concerns
page.content: Social concerns include a busy main road through Fenton, lack of public transport and facilities for teenagers. Deceptive bends on the main road and speeding traffic have caused several accidents. Rising bus fares and fewer passengers have caused a reduction in services. There is little opportunity for youngsters to get to the nearest towns & no possibility of transport home. No playing/field/area exists where youngsters can meet. They tend to congregate around the bus shelter and indulge in minor acts of vandalism. Intensive farming methods producing eggs, chickens and pigs create problems. Strong smells and meal dust periodically pervade the air, mainly when waste is removed and slurry is spread on surrounding fields. Late deliveries of mail and newspapers are a minor irritant.
